page.title: 11ATTITUDES
page.content: The section surveyed is primarily an agricultural area of scattered farmsteads which has little in the way of amenities,the only one being Stoneybeck Inn and restaurant.The portion of Plumpton village,Known as Brockley Moor,has no common meeting place_the school,which is in Plumpton Parish North,being inconvenient for most adult activites,while the Greenacreas Club,also in the Northern section,is able to hold dances and discos.There is no village sports ground.The nearest amenities are at Penrith 4\ miles S or Carlisle 9 miles N_Lazonby 4miles E,has an open air swimming pool. Of the 12 families interviewed,9 thought that the village needed a communal meeting place.The rest ranged from wanting lower bus fares to a play school.
